benchmark_details.name: MAFALDA (Multi-level Annotated Fallacy Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: MAFALDA is a benchmark for fallacy classification that merges and unites previous fallacy datasets, providing a taxonomy that aligns, refines, and unifies existing classifications of fallacies, along with a new annotation scheme allowing for subjective annotations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for detecting and classifying fallacies in text, enabling evaluation of language models and human performances.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset may contain sensitive content such as racism and misogyny, and it is relatively small due to the time-intensive nature of the annotation process.

data.source: The benchmark merges multiple existing fallacy datasets, including those from Sahai et al. (2021), Martino et al. (2019), Jin et al. (2022), and Goffredo et al. (2022).
data.annotation: Manual annotation by authors with explanations for each annotation, including the introduction of a new disjunctive annotation scheme.

methodology.calculation: Precision and recall are calculated based on the matches between annotations and predictions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance in detecting and classifying fallacies.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance results across several models with human baseline comparisons provided in the study.
methodology.validation: All annotations were discussed among authors to reach consensus or provide alternative annotations.
